intro: Souroubea pilophora, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous tree native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to dry climates and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its latex sap has been traditionally used for various medicinal and practical purposes.
